bibl.title: Graeco-Egyptian Naming Practices: A Network Perspective.
bibl.note: Thanks to the Trismegistos People database, the ca. 375,000 Greek, Egyptian, and Latin names attested in Egypt can be usefully studied with network visualization and analysis to provide a fresh perspective on naming practices. - The data [of a sample survey: 337 papyri from Hermopolis dating to A.D. 101-130]. - Network structure. - Naming patterns. - Linguistic origin vs linguistic affiliation. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: Yanne Broux, Graeco-Egyptian Naming Practices: A Network Perspective.

Thanks to the Trismegistos People database, the ca. 375,000 Greek, Egyptian, and Latin names attested in Egypt can be usefully studied with network visualization and analysis to provide a fresh perspective on naming practices. - The data [of a sample survey: 337 papyri from Hermopolis dating to A.D. 101-130]. - Network structure. - Naming patterns. - Linguistic origin vs linguistic affiliation. - Avec résumé en anglais.
